newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE cocoa off one-year high, still firmer.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE cocoa off one-year high, still firmer.

text.p: LIFFE cocoa futures rallied to a one-year peak early in the session on Tuesday but ended the morning trade firmer but off day's highs.
Benchmark September advanced to 1,169 stg a tonne, the highest since June 1996, after gapping 15 stg higher at the open and breaching the previous support at 1,162.
But it lacked further upward momentum and the contract ended the morning business 12 down at 1,162 after a seven stg range.
"I think a lot of people are waiting to buy if the market goes down," said one trader.
Traders said business was less brisk and it centred on light July/Sept switches and AA trades.
Overall volume totalled just 4,131 lots, compared with Monday's full-day volume of 14,112 lots.
Monday's session was dominated by massive against actual trade, the bulk of it posted against the July contract ahead the first tender day on Tuesday.
A total of 4,301 10-tonne lots were tendered on Tuesday. But traders said the quantity was within expectation based on the large number of grading and the sizeable amount available for tenders.
The open interest on July shrank sharply to 7,500 lots by the close of business on Monday from 15,000 on Friday, LIFFE said.

Fundamentally, traders were keeping an eye on second quarter European cocoa grind data, due later this week or early next week. Analysts said the figures were expected to show a mixed trend. -- Jalil Hamid, London newsroom +44 171 542 4985
